news_header: A man named Nasir Ahmad Tawhedi was arrested for allegedly planning an ISIS-inspired attack on Election Day in the US.
news_text: The US Department of Justice arrested 27-year-old Nasir Ahmad Tawhedi, an Afghan citizen living in Oklahoma City, for allegedly conspiring to carry out a violent attack on Election Day motivated by ISIS. Tawhedi is charged with providing support to a foreign terrorist organization and attempting to procure firearms for the attack. He reportedly collaborated with a juvenile co-conspirator and consumed ISIS propaganda online. Investigators found that he had researched surveillance cameras and states with lax gun laws, and he sought AK-47 rifles for the attack. Tawhedi was arrested after attempting to purchase weapons from undercover FBI agents. He confirmed plans for an attack targeting large gatherings and expressed intent to die during the act. Tawhedi arrived in the US in September 2021 on a special immigrant visa.
